news.title: Taoiseach tells Mary Lou McDonald to ‘cop on’ as Sinn Féin leader says ‘I don’t need you to mansplain the economy to me’ in Dáil row
news.summary: Taoiseach Micheál Martin has claimed that inflation is coming down as he told Sinn Féin leader Mary Lou McDonald to ‘cop on’ in a testy Dáil exchange.

news.title: Man accused of sexual assault of girl (10) near Citywest ‘fit to be tried’ and may face more serious charges
news.summary: A man accused of sexually assaulting a 10-year-old girl in west Dublin last month is “fit to be tried” and could face more serious charges, a court has heard.

news.title: Ranking Ireland’s potential World Cup play-off opponents: What would best draw be for Boys In Green?
news.summary: Another dramatic night of World Cup qualifying action and now we know the four potential opponents Ireland could face in the play-off semi-final on March 26 next year.

news.title: The Damien Duff interview: ‘There was only one person that I let down when I left. I hope I don’t upset other people. But the only person I let down was Joe’
news.summary: In his first big interview since leaving Tolka Park, Damien Duff admits he tried many ways to fill the void but he sees his future in Irish football.

news.title: Fionnán Sheahan: Promoting himself shows Simon Harris doesn’t trust Fine Gael ministers to be competent – or not to undermine him
news.summary: Irreplaceable. Paschal Donohoe’s departure as finance minister highlights the paucity of talent in Fine Gael.

news.title: Living with COPD: It often looks to others like nothing’s wrong, but when our breathing is bad, we tend to stay at home
news.summary: When Joe Claffey was first diagnosed with chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD), he panicked. “My instant reaction was to think, that’s it. I’m going to die,” says the, now, 70-year-old retired father of three, from Stoneybatter in Dublin.

news.title: Three years of trespassing – How Enoch Burke came to face a fourth spell in prison
news.summary: It has been more than three years since Enoch Burke was first ordered not to trespass on the grounds of Wilson's Hospital School.

news.title: Ask a money coach: ‘Do I have to contribute 50/50 to my stepchildren’s holidays?’
Carenting: Three Irish people who care for elderly parents on the mental, physical and financial toll – and their advice to others
news.summary: There are currently more than 500,000 people looking after a parent or loved one in Ireland. Parents look after their children until they fly the nest, then the roles are reversed.

news.title: ‘I never had a burning desire to be Taoiseach’ – Paschal Donohoe on ambitions, Gerry ‘The Monk’ Hutch potentially taking his seat and Covid regrets
news.summary: Former finance minister Paschal Donohoe has said he never had any ambition to become taoiseach during his lengthy career in politics.
